abstract.text: A power scale created with a continuous input domain that provides methods to convert values within that domain to an output range.
Creates a new power scale for the domain of
to the value you provide.
The exponent value of the scale.
Processes a value against the scale, potentially constraining or dropping the value.
Transforms the input value using a power function and maps the resulting value into the range you provide.
A type that maps continuous values from an input
to an output
A type that can be converted into an approximate value that is easier to understand.
The number of ticks desired when creating the scale.
A value that represents how a scale handles data transformation that exceed the domain or range of the scale.
Converts a value comparing it to the input domain, transforming the value, and mapping it into values between
and to the upper bound you provide.
Transforms a value within the range into the associated domain value.
Returns a new scale with the range set to the values you provide.
Transforms the input value using a power function and maps the resulting value into the range you provide.
A power scale created with a continuous input domain that provides methods to convert values within that domain to an output range.
A type that can be consistently converted to and from a Double.
Returns a new scale with the domain set to the values you provide.
The type of continuous scale.
Returns a new scale with the domain inferred from the list of values you provide.
The distance or length between the upper and lower bounds of the input domain.
A logarithmic scale created with a continuous input domain that provides methods to convert values within that domain to an output range.
Creates a new power scale for the upper and lower bounds of the domain range you provide.
The lower bound of the input domain.
Converts a value comparing it to the upper value of a range, mapping it to the input domain, and inverting scale’s transform.
The type of continuous scale.
A type that maps values from an input
to an output
Returns a new scale with the domain set to the values you provide.
Converts an array of values that matches the scale’s input type to a list of ticks that are within the scale’s domain.
A linear scale for transforming and mapping continuous input values within a domain to output values you provide.
The upper bound of the input domain.
Returns a new scale with the transform set to the value you provide.
A collection of components to provide structures that support data visualization.
Returns a new scale with the range set to the values you provide.
Transforms the input value using a power function and maps the resulting value into the range you provide.
A continuous scale for transforming and mapping continuous input values within a domain to output values you provide.

Transforms a value within the range into the associated domain value.
A linear scale for transforming and mapping continuous input values within a domain to output values you provide.
A Boolean value that indicates if the mapping from domain to range is inverted.
Converts a value comparing it to the upper value of a range, mapping it to the input domain, and inverting scale’s transform.
Returns a list of strings that make up the valid tick values out of the set that you provide.
The upper bound of the input domain.
The lower bound of the input domain.

and to the upper bound you provide.

A transformation value that indicates whether the output vales are constrained to the min and max of the output range.
